Posts.Content: Feb 29, 2008 07:45PM elaine41 wrote: hello ladies, I just had my 12th tx today.  I am starting to get a little red.  I'm using the aquaphor.  I was told to only use this.  I have noticed swelling above my clavicle - anyone else have this.  Lionessdoe- your comments made me laugh.  Everytime, I lie on the table I think about the "no deodorant".  Thankfully, no hair growth yet on the legs or armpits.  How sad that that is the bright spot. mpellot- I love your idea about the punch card.  I think we should all treat ourselves to a facial or massage after each week of treatment. I love reading all your posts, it truly keeps me sane having people that truly "get it" Elaine
Posts.Title: Looking for a February Rad Team debbbyb twirlgirl

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2008 06:02PM elaine41 wrote: Hello all, Has anyone had a portagram?  My right arm (side port is on) became swollen just prior to my last chemo tx. in Dec.  My onc.  sent me right away for a doppler to see if there was a blood clot.  There was no sign of one.  It has been continually swollen, the nurses at the rad. onc. office thought I had lymphedema (wrong side though).  Called the surgeons office and they set me up to have a portagram tomorrow to check to see if my port is leaking.  Anyone have this test? Thanks, Elaine
Posts.Title: Looking for a February Rad Team debbbyb twirlgirl

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2008 06:51PM elaine41 wrote: Hi everyone,    blue willow- I was also asked to bring my old mammogram films to my radiation appointment.  I brought my original one from August, but I also had another one when I finished chemo in December.    slbooch - I started taking the tamoxifen, the day after surgery, 1/16.  The main side effect has been hot flashes.  I get about 6-7 a day, they do wake me at times, but they only last a few minutes thankfully.  My onc. did tell me they could get worse, but not bad so far.  Elaine
Posts.Title: Looking for a February Rad Team debbbyb twirlgirl

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2008 08:49AM elaine41 wrote: hello all, I had my simulation yesterday, 2 tattoos.  Wasn't bad, thought it would hurt worse- just a pinch.  Actually, didn't feel the one under my arm at all, still numb from surgery (1/16).  The whole process only took 1/2 hour.  I was surprised that they took photos of my breasts.  I jokingly told them I better not find these on the internet. I have an x-ray next week and then will start radiation.  I wasn't told not to wear a bra, but was told a sports bra may be more comfortable.  I was also told to use cornstarch, but no deodorant.  I am quite fair skinned and worried about burns, so I appreciate the suggestions about creams.  Also I am on tamoxifen, my rad. onc.  said it is not usual for patients to be on tamoxifen while receiving rads.  I questioned my onc. about this and he said it is fine and to continue it during radiation.  Anyone else taking tamoxifen during radiation?
Posts.Title: Looking for a February Rad Team debbbyb twirlgirl
